SpecifiedBy.SpecText: [The feature] #clockMode [is] prohibited.
[The feature] #clockMode [is] prohibited.
All features specified in [TTML2] are prohibited unless specified otherwise below. [The feature #clockMode is not specified]

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The attribute ttp:clockMode shall not be present.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: While this attribute affects only the 'clock' timebase, some text-based profiles like IMSC1 only allow the 'media' timebase, as this timeline is usually used for Internet distribution. Thus this attribute would have no meaning, if present.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: The ttp:profile attribute SHOULD be present on the tt element and equal to the designator of the IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms, and the ttp:profile element SHOULD NOT be present, unless: the Document Instance also conforms to EBU-TT-D, in which case the ttp:profile attribute and the ttp:profile element SHOULD NOT be present, and instead the designator of the IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms and the URI "urn:ebu:tt:distribution:2014-01" SHOULD each be carried in an ebuttm:conformsToStandard element as specified in EBU-TT-D; or the Document Instance also conforms to ttml10-sdp-us, in which case the ttp:profile attribute SHOULD NOT be present. ttml10-sdp-us requires that the ttp:profile element be present and that its use attribute be set to a specified value.

The ttp:profile attribute SHOULD be present on the tt element and equal to the designator of the IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms, and the ttp:profile element SHOULD NOT be present, unless: the Document Instance also conforms to EBU-TT-D, in which case neither the ttp:profile attribute nor the ttp:profile element are present, and, instead the designator of the IMSC1 profile to which the Document Instance conforms and the URI "urn:ebu:tt:distribution:2014-01" SHOULD each be carried in an ebuttm:conformsToStandard element as specified in EBU-TT-D and illustrated in I.2 EBU-TT-D; or the Document Instance also conforms to ttml10-sdp-us, in which case the ttp:profile attribute is not present and the ttp:profile element is present, as illustrated in I.3 SDP-US.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The IMSC1 profile should be signalled.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: The used IMSC1 profile should be signalled to indicate the specification conformance of a document. This eases possible further processing.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: A ttp:displayAspectRatio attribute is considered to be significant only when specified on the tt element.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The ttp:displayAspectRatio attribute is only significant when specified on the tt:tt element.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: The ttp:displayAspectRatio attribute specifies the ratio of the width to the height of a rectangular area that is used for mapping the Root Container to the image frame of the video. As this property affects the complete document, it is defined once and only significant on the tt:tt element.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: 2 lines maximum

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: A subtitle must use at most two lines.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: It is good practice to only use a limited number of lines within a subtitle.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Minimum duration: 5/6 (five-sixths) of a second per subtitle event (e.g. 20 frames for 24fps)

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The duration of a subtitle must be at least 5/6 seconds.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: A subtitle has to met a specific minimum subtitle duration.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Maximum duration: 7 seconds per subtitle event

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The duration of a subtitle must be at most 7 seconds.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: A subtitle has to met a specific maximum subtitle duration.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: 2 frames minimum (regardless of frame rate)

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The gap between two adjacent subtitles must be at least two frames.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: There has to be a reasonable amount of gap between two adjacent subtitles where no subtitle is displayed.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: A Document Instance SHALL use UTF-8 character encoding as specified in UNICODE.
A Document Instance SHALL use UTF-8 character encoding as specified in UNICODE.
A Document Instance SHALL be [...] using the UTF-8 character encoding as specified in [UNICODE].

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: It is common practice that a document encoding is specified in the XML declaration. Without this information the encoding can often not be determined and the constraints regarding document encoding (e.g. to just use UTF-8) could not be checked.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: 2 frames minimum (regardless of frame rate)

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: It is good practice to have linearly increasing timecodes i.e. no subsequent subtitle starts before the current one.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: While TTML does not require linearly increasing timecodes, such timecodes ease content processing.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Use tts:textAlign and tts:displayAlign for positioning along with static values for tts:extent and tts:origin.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The tts:textAlign attribute must be used for horizontal alignment of subtitles.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Use tts:textAlign and tts:displayAlign for positioning along with static values for tts:extent and tts:origin.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The tts:displayAlign attribute must be used for vertical alignment of subtitles.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Use tts:textAlign and tts:displayAlign for positioning along with static values for tts:extent and tts:origin.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The tts:origin attribute must be used for subtitle positioning.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The tts:extent attribute must be used for subtitle positioning.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The tts:fontSize attribute must be present.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: tts:fontSize shall be defined as 100%.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The tts:fontSize attribute must be set to "100%".

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Only text/characters included in the NETFLIX Glyph List (version 2) can be used.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: Only certain glyphs are supported by Netflix.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: 2 frames minimum (regardless of frame rate)

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: It is recommended that the ttp:frameRate attribute is present on the tt:tt element, as it is required to check the Netflix frame gap constraint.

Constraint.ShortName: No timing on content elements other than tt:p

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: Sample TTML snippet for Subtitle and SDH can be found [...].

Constraint.ShortDescription: No timing on content elements other than tt:p
Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: It is recommended that no timing is present immediately on content elements other than tt:p, as such timing is currently not processed by the respective constraint checks.
Constraint.LongDescriptionUser: It is good practice to use timing only on the tt:p element, as this element corresponds to a single subtitle and contains of one or more lines. While it is possible to also use timing on tt:span level, this is usually only used for cumulative subtitling and hence quite seldom.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: [The feature] #zIndex [is] permitted-deprecated.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The use of the tts:zIndex attribute is deprecated, as it has no effect, because presented regions do not overlap.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: [The IMSC feature] #altText [is] permitted-deprecated.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The use of the ittm:altText element is deprecated, as the altText named metadata item provides equivalent semantics.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: [The IMSC feature] #aspectRatio [is] permitted-deprecated.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The use of the ittp:aspectRatio attribute is deprecated, as the ttp:displayAspectRatio attribute of TTML2 provides equivalent semantics.

SpecifiedBy.SpecText: [The IMSC feature] #progressivelyDecodable [is] permitted-deprecated.

Constraint.ShortDescriptionUser: The use of the ittp:progressivelyDecodable is deprecated, as it has not found practical uses.
